1.name: The Son of Kong
1.description: The men who captured the giant ape King Kong return to Skull Island and find his likewise gigantic but far more friendly son.

2.name: King Kong
2.description: A film crew goes to a tropical island for an exotic location shoot and discovers a colossal ape who takes a shine to their female blonde star. He is then captured and brought back to New York City for public exhibition.

3.name: The Invisible Man
3.description: A scientist finds a way of becoming invisible, but in doing so, he becomes murderously insane.

4.name: Little Women
4.description: A chronicle of the lives of a group of sisters growing up in nineteenth-century America.

5.name: Ekstase
5.description: Eva has just gotten married to an older gentleman, but discovers that he is obsessed with order in his life and doesn't have much room for passion. She becomes despondent and leaves him, ...                See full summary »

6.name: 42nd Street
6.description: A director puts on what may be his last Broadway show and, at the last moment, a naive newcomer has to replace the star.

7.name: Duck Soup
7.description: Rufus T. Firefly is named president/dictator of bankrupt Freedonia and declares war on neighboring Sylvania over the love of wealthy Mrs. Teasdale.

8.name: Dinner at Eight
8.description: Affluent Millicent and Oliver Jordan throw a dinner for a handful of wealthy and/or well-born acquaintances, each of whom has much to reveal.

9.name: Alice in Wonderland
9.description: In Victorian England a bored young girl dreams that she has entered a fantasy world called Wonderland populated by even more fantastic characters.

10.name: Footlight Parade
10.description: Chester Kent struggles against time, romance, and a rival's spy to produce spectacular live "prologues" for movie houses.

11.name: Sons of the Desert
11.description: When Stan and Ollie trick their wives into thinking that they are taking a medicinal cruise while they're actually going to a convention, the wives find out the truth the hard way.

12.name: Cavalcade
12.description: The triumphs and tragedies of two English families, the upper-crust Marryots and the working-class Bridges, from 1899 to 1933 are portrayed.

13.name: The Private Life of Henry VIII.
13.description: King Henry VIII marries five more times after his divorce from his first wife Catherine of Aragon.

14.name: Gold Diggers of 1933
14.description: A wealthy composer rescues unemployed Broadway performers with a new play.

15.name: Baby Face
15.description: A young woman, sexually exploited all her life, decides to turn the tables and exploit the hapless men at a big city bank - by gleefully sleeping her way to the top.

16.name: Morning Glory
16.description: When a naively innocent, aspiring actress arrives on the Broadway scene, she is taken under the wing of several theater veterans who mentor her to ultimate success.

17.name: Bombshell
17.description: Sexpot film star Lola Burns seeks a new image and tries marrying a marquis and adopting a baby - all sorts of schemes which go awry.

18.name: Design for Living
18.description: A woman cannot decide between two men who love her, and the trio agree to try living together in a platonic friendly relationship.

19.name: Mystery of the Wax Museum
19.description: The disappearance of people and corpses leads a reporter to a wax museum and a sinister sculptor.

20.name: Das Testament des Dr. Mabuse
20.description: French version of the German movie Das Testament des Dr. Mabuse (1933). Both movies were directed simultaneously by Fritz Lang in Germany.

21.name: When Ladies Meet
21.description: Mary, a writer working on a novel about a love triangle, is attracted to her publisher. Her suitor Jimmy is determined to break them up; he introduces Mary to the publisher's wife without ...                See full summary »

22.name: Flying Down to Rio
22.description: An aviator and band leader who is always getting his group fired for his flirtatious behavior with the female guests soon finds himself falling for an engaged woman.

23.name: Queen Christina
23.description: Queen Christina of Sweden is a popular monarch who is loyal to her country. However, when she falls in love with a Spanish envoy, she must choose between the throne and the man she loves.

24.name: The Story of Temple Drake
24.description: A wealthy but neurotic Southern belle finds herself trapped in the hideout of a gang of vicious bootleggers. The gang's leader lusts after her, and is determined not to let anything stand in the way of his having her.

25.name: She Done Him Wrong
25.description: In the Gay Nineties, a seductive nightclub singer contends with several suitors, including a jealous escaped convict and a handsome temperance league member.

26.name: The Kennel Murder Case
26.description: Philo Vance, accompanied by his prize-losing Scottish terrier, investigates the locked-room murder of a prominent and much-hated collector whose broken Chinese vase provides an important clue.

27.name: The Vampire Bat
27.description: When corpses drained of blood begin to show up in a European village, vampirism is suspected to be responsible.

28.name: Dancing Lady
28.description: An attractive dancer is rescued from jail by a rich man, who helps her to have her first big opportunity at a musical play on Broadway.

29.name: Elysia (Valley of the Nude)
29.description: A reporter is assigned to write a article on a nudist camp.

30.name: Supernatural
30.description: A serial black widow murderess returns to life in the body of a young woman to exact revenge on a former lover, a phony spiritualist who betrayed her.

31.name: The Eagle and the Hawk
31.description: The pilots of a Royal Air Force squadron in World War I face not only physical but mental dangers in their struggle to survive while fighting the enemy.

32.name: Roman Scandals
32.description: A kind-hearted young man is thrown out of his corrupt home town of West Rome, Oklahoma. He falls asleep and dreams that he is back in the days of olden Rome, where he gets mixed up with court intrigue and a murder plot against the Emperor.

33.name: Riders of Destiny
33.description: Bad guy Kincaid controls the local water supply and plans to do in the other ranchers. Government agent Saunders shows up undercover to do in Kincaid and win the heart of one of his victims Fay Denton.

34.name: The Ghoul
34.description: An Egyptologist returns from the dead to take revenge on those who have violated his tomb.

35.name: Christopher Strong
35.description: A famous female flier and a member of Parliament drift into a potentially disastrous affair.

36.name: Bureau of Missing Persons
36.description: Butch Saunders has been transferred to Missing Persons because he was too brutal in other police work. He regards the assignment as "kindergarten" work. When a young woman asks him to help ...                See full summary »

37.name: Eskimo
37.description: The happy life of an Eskimo is disastrously changed when he mingles with an unscrupulous white trader.

38.name: Going Gay
38.description: Two Englishmen in Germany fall for a lady singer and try and make her a star.

39.name: A Study in Scarlet
39.description: In London, a secret society led by lawyer Thaddeus Merrydew collects the assets of any of its deceased members and divides them among the remaining members. Society members start dropping ...                See full summary »

40.name: Ex-Lady
40.description: Although free spirit Helen Bauer does not believe in marriage, she consents to marry Don, but his infidelities cause her to also take on a lover.

41.name: Lady for a Day
41.description: A gangster tries to make Apple Annie, the Times Square apple seller, a lady for a day.

42.name: Wild Boys of the Road
42.description: In the depths of the Depression, two teenage boys strike out on their own in order to help their struggling parents and find life on the road tougher than expected.

43.name: Sagebrush Trail
43.description: The Duke is wrongly convicted for a killing, but he escapes from prison and heads out west to find the real killer.

44.name: Counsellor at Law
44.description: Successful attorney has his Jewish heritage and poverty-stricken background brought home to him when he learns his wife has been unfaithful.

45.name: The Sin of Nora Moran
45.description: Nora Moran, a young woman with a difficult and tragic past, is sentenced to die for a murder that she did not commit. She could easily reveal the truth and save her own life, if only it ...                See full summary »

46.name: Gabriel Over the White House
46.description: A political hack becomes President during the height of the Depression and undergoes a metamorphosis into an incorruptible statesman after a near-fatal accident.

47.name: Employees' Entrance
47.description: A working girl is menaced by her tyrannical employer.

48.name: Lady Killer
48.description: A former gangster makes it big in Hollywood, but his old life catches up with him.

49.name: The Prizefighter and the Lady
49.description: An ex-sailor turned boxer finds romance and gets a shot at the heavyweight title.

50.name: The White Sister
50.description: A young woman falls in love with a dashing officer, but becomes a nun when she believes him to be killed in battle.
